summary: MFA only required first time

value.text:
1. Log in into Earthscape
2. Go to account settings ( https://SUBDOMAIN.earthscape.com/account/profile )
3. Select MFA
4. Follow the process to enable MFA
5. Sign out from Earthscape
6. Sign in, input the required MFA code from the Authy app
7. Sign out
8. Sign in
After signing in again again (step 8), you should be prompted to input a new MFA token.
Signing in again skips MFA.

description: Earthscape users can opt-in into 2nd factor authentication using [Authy](https://authy.com/features/).

summary: MFA - Authy in Apple's App Store is called "Twilio Authy"

value.text:
We should include the following to mitigate confusion:
  - Authy's Icon
  - A link to the app in Google Play/Apple App Store




#### *Links*

Google Play: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.authy.authy
Apple App Store: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/twilio-authy/id494168017

description: In the signup process, we state the use of Authy with a small block of instructions. In both Google Play and Apple's App Store, the app is called "Twilio Authy", and I'm concerned we may cause confusion with some users on the correct app to use.

summary: Cancelling the MFA Sign-up Process can lock user out of account

value.text:
1. Head to stage.earthscape.com > Account Settings > MFA
2. Input your country code and phone number
3. Click the "Enable MFA" button
4. On the next screen (which is asking for the MFA Token), click "Cancel"
5. Note that you're brought back to the MFA Token entry page
The user would return to their Account Settings > MFA page and MFA would be disabled
MFA is still enabled and required for the user to login.

description: When enabling MFA, if the user cancels the process, an MFA Token is still required to login.

summary: Quarterly Meeting - Q2_2021

value.text:
Matjaz Drolc
Dylan Dille
Madison Kuhn

field.name: (Q) Nature of where the product stands in the development cycle

value.text: Active development iterations for improvement and bug fixes ongoing.

field.name: Review of previous action items and (Q) quality objectives

value.text:
#### Earthscape in a box
 - we are waiting for a meeting with IAC to define technical requirements (datacenter parameters)

#### Security Risks
 - in progress
 - collaboration between Matjaz and Logan

#### Livestream use in live operations
 - there were bugfixes in Q1 (handling absence absence of audio)
 - autoscaling had to be set up to handle WebRTC and transcoding

#### Legal Liabilities
 - In development: super admins populate Terms & Conditions that must be accepted by the users
 - The initial version of T&C is written

#### RVL Group: wanted the images with geotagging 
 - development still in progress

#### Security Risks
 - Hacking can cause a number of issues, especially in our industry (leaks, deletions, etc.)
 - Complying with certain CMMC requirements could disrupt current workflows or be costly
 - Enhancing cybersecurity is also an opportunity to differentiate ourselves from the competition

#### Legal risks:
 - Terms and Conditions not yet signed by users

#### Earthscape in a box:
 - Risk due to unknown technical requirements
 - Need to developing the procedures for upgrading and management of this air-gapped deployment of Earthscape
 - Shipping OpenStreetMap data is challenging due to the size. Conversation with IAC should lead to satisfactory solution on this (a tradeoff needs to be made between hardware requirements, map performance requirements and geographical coverage)

field.name: (Q) Necessary actions taken to address risks and opportunities

value.text:
#### Security Risks:
 - segregated WordPress virtual machine into a separate network
 - segregated stage and production environments (separate S3 buckets and other cloud resources)
 - tightened firewall configuration inside the cloud
 - tightened Identity & Access Management (IAM) configuration inside AWS. Removed user accounts of previous employees
 - changed SSH configuration on gateway box to use a non-default port

#### Legal risks
 - T&C document has been written
 - started development on interface to upload T&C text into Earthscape and interface for end users to review and agree to them

#### Livestream use in live operations
 - first customers have started testing new low-latency livestreams
 - fixed discovered bugs

#### Earthscape in a box:
 - created a prototype: virtual disk image with Earthscape, deployable into VirtualBox

field.name: (Q) Duration of key efforts to support project

value.text:
#### Security:
 - allocated April 2021 to focus on this issue

#### Legal Liabilities:
 - allocated a week to implement uploading T&C and accepting T&C within Earthscape

#### Security Risks:

 - 10

#### Livestream use in live operations - Legal Liabilities: 

 - 5 (for the fixed, one-time version)

#### Earthscape in a box:

   - Development: 7
   - Market Research: 4

- Increase security and customer data protection
 - Continue growing our customer base
 - Increase the functionality of Earthscape through inclusion of an Images model
 - Expand team:
    - Find quality candidates
    - Improve on our new-hire onboarding process
    - Improve on scaled workflow with a larger team

field.name: Additional Internal and or External resources needed

value.text:
- New web developer to scale team and resources
 - Logan's expertise on management of computer networks and security
 - Potentially a third-party security audit
See "Duration of Key Efforts"

summary: New organization - subdomain value including capitalized letters causes 404

value.text:
1. Enter superadmin panel
2. Navigate to Organizations > New Organization
3. Enter any value into "Name" field
4. Enter a value with at least one capital letter (e.g., "Something")
5. Click "Save"
6. Navigate to the Earthscape url with the subdomain you just entered
7. Note the 404 "Not Found" message
8. Go back and edit organization subdomain, replacing the capital letter with a lower-cased one (e.g., "something")
9. Navigate back to the url
10. Note it is now working
The subdomain would be validated upon "Save" and available for use. Organization subdomain value should be forced to lower-case.
![](image.png)![](image1.png)

summary: Error when jobPercentComplete is missing

value.text:
Could not reproduce.

Tested by writing an integration test which send a STATUS_UPDATE message without jobPercentComplete field.
Response code=200, percent complete set to 0
Response code=500, error

description:
`api/sns/transcoding` expects a field named `jobPercentComplete` when receiving a `STATUS_UPDATE` message.

These messages notify our system about transcoding progress. We expect jobPercentComplete field in them. In reality this field can be missing.

Sentry: https://sentry.io/organizations/churchill-navigation/issues/2114871665/?cursor=0%3A0%3A1&project=219740

summary: Refactor Real-time Metadata Display

value.text:
The real-time metadata display window would be usable and provide value to the user.

## Task
#### ****Only show those values which have been checked in the KLV Timeline****

description:
>Earthscape (stage) now exposes almost everything in Telemetry, Gimbal, Camera, INS sets. There are several problems with keeping the dialog as it is:
usability: too many values shown, hard to navigate
timestamp: Sets of values come in with different timestamps. One timestamp at the top of the dialog is only representing the time when UAS values came. Gimbal/Camera/Telemetry/INS values can have a slightly different timestamp.
technical: having all values in this dialog preempts some optimizations of the data transfer. Loading the data on-demand (when user clicks a checkbox next to a specific KLV field) would be a significant improvement.
Ideas:
select some KLV attributes which are always shown in this dialog. Show others only when they are marked for display in the timeline."
Background Only display those values which are checked for KLV timeline display

summary: Video Privacy Settings - Data validation is needed

value.text:
1. Go to any video page on production
2. Click the "share" icon to load Video Privacy Settings menu
3. In "Days before expiration", either:
    a. Click the down arrow to produce a negative number
    b. Enter a negative value with the keyboard (e.g., -2)
4. Note the date entered into db is actually in the past.
Only positive integers should be allowed

summary: Live streams: bug in port assignment algorithm
description:
TLDR: No consequences of this bug until we run out of port numbers in a couple of months. If WebRTC live streams released before then, this can be closed. Otherwise a simple fix needed.

Each live stream is assigned a port for receiving video data from ION. On production and stage it is selected from range 49000-52000. No two streams can run at the same port simultaneously. But the current port assignment algorithm selects the port such that no two streams can use the same port, ever. This will become a problem when we cross port number 52000 where we run out. Right now we're at 50478. The fix is to recycle port numbers from ended streams.

Also, it is not recommended to select ports in range from `/proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_local_port_range`. Ports in that range can be used for ephemeral connections. It can happen a port in that range is not available. Default range on Ubuntu 20.04 is `32768	60999`.

This will be fixed in WebRTC version of live streams before we run out of port numbers.

description:
## Background
There are inconsistencies with dates for when a user last logged in or performed an action. 

----
## Example
RVL's site:

"User" last active date: 09-29-2020
"User" uploaded a video: 10-14-2020

description:
## Background
Currently, we work off of the aspect ratio of the viewport to understand the orientation (landscape or portrait). This causes issues where users viewing on a desktop have the browser set to be wider than it is tall, because the layout assumes it is in portrait mode. 

### Possible Improvement
If possible (maybe through the `hasMouse` prop?), we should separate the functionality between desktop and mobile for the styling rules and operate off of min-widths for desktop. 

After playing around with the layout, I think 1000px would be a good place to start for causing the video dashboard to split to side-by-side.

summary: Downloading video has weird name and no file extension
Live stream video got stuck processing
description:
#### Environment 
- Streaming from ION-110072 to churchill.earthscape.com
- DFES graph loaded onto the ION
- There was one video stream coming form the ION
#### Steps to Reproduce
These are the steps I took to get this issue to happen. As of 2/17/2020 this has not been attempted to reproduce. This issue will be updated in the future to reflect the attempted reproducability.
1. On the ION -> Setup > Recorders > MX-10 Video (or HD-SDI-1) > Streaming (to prod) > Start
2. Let the ION stream for ~1:05 hours
3. At some point during or after the stream I placed 3 clipmarks by right clicking only
4.  ION -> Setup > Recorders > MX-10 Video (or HD-SDI-1) > Streaming (to prod) > Stop

#### Expected Result
The stream processes for a proportionally long time to the length of the video. Thumbnail appears under "Videos" tab. 

#### Actual Result
As of today (2/17/20) The video still has the message that says "Live Stream has ended" on the video. The Thumbnail for the video does not show up anywhere within ES. I refreshed the page, no difference. 

#### Additional Comments
Here is the link to the "stuck" video https://churchill.earthscape.com/videos/25730
Below is a screenshot the day after it was recorded showing that it was still not processed. Note the date and time of the recording compared to the time and date in the lower right hand corner. 

I have not tried streaming again, in case there is relevant information to be gained from having the stream in this state. But I will soon to see if it resolves the issue, and to see if I can reproduce this issue again.

Video metadata is not being correctly processed for some of the new videos being uploaded, specifically those coming from GEAR/ION2.

    - 10 Users simultaneously
      - Transcoding Concerns
        - Uploading 8 hours of mx-15 video every day

        - Transcoding Changes from Production Site

  - Tests
    - Memory Benchmarks with 32 GB video size uploads (stage server)
    - Test flight points for example video

-Additional Questions-
- Will it be possible to access the the on prem server for maintenance. Preferably through a VPN. Access needed to both, lights-out-management network adapter (HP ILO, Dell IDRAC) and to the adapter where Earthscape will be exposed. If not, what are alternatives / examples of practices for maintaining other similar products? Do they have a technician with physical access to server?
- What are data retention requirements? (this is important to estimate database size where flight points take a sizeable amount of space)
- What devices will they be using to access Earthscape? Are their web browsers kept up to date?
- Do they have internal DNS server with internal domains and do they issue SSL certificates for those?
- What will their video workflow look like? Try to find out how much time is there before video needs to be ready for viewing.
- Have they picked storage solution? Do they have existing network storage solution? Does it support NFS?

description:
We need a way to pass messages to users/admins from the Superadmin panel.

This would require, at a minimum, the following:
1. Site Selection - Choose whether to send the message to
  - ALL sites
  - Select Sites Only (with checkboxes to flag a subset of organizations)
  - Current Organization's Site Only
2. Audience selection
  - All Users
  - Admins Only
3. Message Type
  - Flash Message
  - Pop-up Message
  - Email
  - Notification Center (does not yet exist)

This feature should continue to grow as our customer base does. Eventually, we could have an automated system to understand the affected user group from a known issue and have it notify them respectively.

summary: ACL: Allow users to edit any video
description:
Why?
Some customers want to define a group of users who can edit any video. Right now we don't have a way to change video editing permissions.

Proposed solution:
Right now we have a setting `ACL_DEFAULT_VIDEO_GROUP` which defines a group of users who can view any video. Similarly, we can add another setting `ACL_DEFAULT_VIDEO_UPDATE_GROUP` who are by default given permission to update any video

Alternative proposed solution:
Expand dropdowns under Admin -> User Groups -> Actions -> Edit Permissions

Before: Allowed/Denied

After:
 - Allowed to edit any video
 - Allowed to edit specific videos (their own uploads)
 - Not allowed

summary: ACL: button to reset all permissions within an organization

value.text:
1. Click "Superadmin" in the left menu
2. Choose "Organizations"
3. Click "Actions" dropdown
4. Click "Reset permissions (ACL)"

description:
Why?
Organizations sometimes want to transition from the simple authorization mode to more advanced ACL. As documented in ESW-225 this involves manually granting permission on all existing videos. This can be very time consuming process.

Proposed solution:
Add a button to Superadmin -> Organizations -> menu next to each organization -> **Reset permissions (ACL)**. Clicking this button would become standard part of migrating an organization to the ACL mode. It would ensure each video can be viewed by group defined by the setting `ACL_DEFAULT_VIDEO_GROUP` (usually root).

Related: ESW-225, ESW-263

summary: Add point and line filtering for videos with varying elevations

value.text:
1. Go to https://churchill.earthscape.com/videos/9264
2. Skip to 26:15 in the video
3. Look at (or place, if one is not present) a dot on the truck that is stationary
4. Play the video for about 10-20 seconds.
5. Note the "new" position of the dot

As a user, regardless of the elevation, you would expect if you place a point for it to remain in that location. Or, if for some reason that is not possible, give a message/reason as to why. For example, if it is not possible for a dot to remain (from the users perspective) in the same location, put a message somewhere saying "using draw tools on places with varying elevation may not appear to be accurate and may appear to float around the video).
Or, in places with fairly high elevations, do not allow the user to use the draw tools at all, by limiting them from using the tools and having a message appear that says something like "Elevation too high to draw accurate annotations" or something. Just suggestions, but the current behavior should be altered.

summary: When the User page is active, the admin page is highlighted

value.text:
Need to be on an admin account to see this. 
1. Go to stage.earthscape.com
2. Management > Users
The selection should be highlighted

Instead, 'Admin' is highlighted. 

I understand the user tab is technically under the Admin tab, but since we give the option to directly select 'User', that option should be highlighted when clicked.
![](Uploading image.png...)

description: This is a very minor bug, but worth a quick fix.

summary: Add ability to delete multiple videos at once

value.text: User either hits a button that says 'select multiple' or a long hold on mobile, just as in google photos.

description: It would be nice for users to be able to delete multiple videos at one given time, rather than have to delete the videos individually via the settings page. Something like the behavior of deleting videos on google photos - selecting multiple and then hitting delete. This could also work along side ESW-369, categorizing videos into separate directories.

summary: Feedback needed when recovering password

value.text: There should be a message that pops up saying 'An email was sent!' or something similar.

description:
#### Description
When a user is recovering a password, there is no indication that an email was sent to them to reset the password. 

1. Go to login page (you need to be logged out).
2. Select 'Forgot Password'
3. Type in a valid email and hit 'Recover Password'

Issue: An email was sent but nothing tells you that.

summary: Enable "Pause" when video screen clicked.

value.text:
1. Videos > Select Video
2. As video plays, click on the video itself 
3. The video should pause, and there should be a flash of a pause symbol over the screen that the video was paused. 
4. Once the video is clicked again, the video should play, with a play symbol that flashes over the screen.

description: Just as in YouTube, Netflix, Hulu, etc. clicking on the video pauses the video. This should be the same for ES videos, as long as the draw tools are not enabled.

summary: Video will not start playing automatically through shared link

value.text:
1. Go to stage.earthscape.com
2. Videos > click on any video
3. Video Privacy > share publicly > copy the link
4. Enter the link into a new window/tab
5. Notice the video not playing right away
The video should play right away indicated by the playback buttons. Or, the playback buttons should indicate that the video is paused.

The video does not play automatically. The video will start playing if the screen is clicked anywhere. Also, if the user does not have an es account/is not logged in, and they click somewhere on the timeline and hit refresh, it brings them to the log in page. Not sure if this is the same issue, but can break it off into a different ticket if so. 

![](image.png)

description:
#### Description 
When accessing a video through a shared link, whether signed in with an account or with no ES account, the video will not start playing automatically, even though the playback button indicates that a video should be playing.

summary: Retention > Tag Value should have drop down menu
description:
#### Steps to Reproduce
1. Admin > Retention > New Retention Policy > Tag-specific retention periods
2. Press the green plus button
3. Click any item from "Tag" drop down menu
4. Note "Tag Value" field

#### Expected Result
The "Tag Value" field also has a drop down menu, just like the tag does


#### Actual Result
There is no drop down menu. The user has to remember which tag value they want and type it in correctly, rather than just picking from a list.

summary: Discrepancy in password requirements resetting through email vs 'Account Settings'
description:
When recovering a password using email, the requirement says that the password must be at least 6 characters.

When resetting the password through account settings > change password, it says you need a minimum of 8 characters etc.

For reference, you do only need 6 characters, and they can all be letters. 

See pictures below for comparison:

![](image.png) - Email Recovery
![](image1.png)  - Account Settings

summary: Password Requirements and Validation

value.text: Increased security via more stringent password requirements.

description:
#### Description of Issue
Currently, users are able to create any password with a validation on password length only. In order to increase our security, we will increase those password requirements.

#### Expected Progress 
1. Choose a security standard
2. Implement the security standard 
3. Test for function and compliance
4. Force password change for all existing users

summary: Password requirement discrepancies for creating an account through invitation vs other.

value.text:
1. With an Admin account, Invite a new user to create an account (Users > Invite Users > fill out the fields so to be able to test)
2. Go to the email that the invitation was sent to and click the link to activate the account
3. In the password section, type in a password that is at least 6 chars long (ex: froggy1)
4. Repeat the password and hit submit. The first photo attached below will appear
5. Instead, use a password that is 8 chars long, (ex: froggy11)
6. The account will be created, and it will bring you to the dashboard. 
7. Go to account > Reset Password
8. The message will say that it needs to be at least 8. This is false, and is listed in ESW-282
9. Reset the password to one with 6 chars (ex:froggy) and save.
This does not produce an error.





![](image.png)![](image1.png)
Expected that resetting the password would require the user to use 8 chars/the limits listed in the description.
The user can reset the password with only 6 chars successfully.

description:
#### Description
Creating an account through user invitation requires password of 8 characters, where everywhere else requires 6. See images below for an explanation.

summary: Password Efforts
description:
#### Description of Issue/Feature/Task and steps to reproduce (if applicable)
Houses multiple issues currently facing Earthscape regarding passwords.


#### Expected Interaction
Passwords should be:
  - Secure
  - Recoverable by admin
  - Recoverable by the affected user
  - Validated through consistent, global requirements (independent of reason or method for setting/resetting password)
 

#### Actual Result/Completed Tasks (what actually happens when you go through the steps, or what you've completed)
See linked issues below.

summary: Tracking migration to Python 3
description:
Issue for tracking progress on migration to Python 3.

Right now our backend uses Python 2 which reached it's end of life on 31/12/2019. The last planned release is coming out in April. After that, there might be no more fixes.
Most projects out there migrated to Python 3 already. 

 - A large part of our codebase can be migrated using scripts like futurize ( https://python-future.org/futurize.html#forwards-conversion )

summary: Check KLV for "Full" values (Roll, Pitch, etc.) are being sent from ARS correctly
description:
ORIGINAL ISSUE IS BELOW:
Timeline: Roll is capping out at 50, not using correct KLV value

From Ivan's trip to Baltimore, they flew at some very steep angles (>50 degrees) but the videos uploaded (http://bpd.earthscape.com/) never went above 50 degrees for roll, which is the standard roll KLV's maximum.

However, whenever we write out "Platform Roll Angle" we usually also write out a "Platform Roll Angle (Full)" entry, which is capped at +/- 90 degrees instead of 50.

My expectation would be that we should always be using that Full Roll as the Roll value shown in the KLV metadata list.  Only if the "Platform Roll Angle (Full)" entry is missing should we then fall back on using "Platform Roll Angle" for that value.  To prevent confusion for users, we should only ever just show "Roll" in the metadata and source it from one klv entry or the other.  It would be confusing to have both roll values in the metadata list.

As part of this, we should make sure we're doing the same with "Platform Pitch Angle" and "Platform Pitch Angle (Full)" as the non-full version has a crazy-small +/- 20 degree restriction (vs +/- 90 for the full version).

If it does turn out that we are already doing this, we then need to get the ARS team involved in trying to determine why we didn't have the full klv values in Baltimore.

A potential solution: Upon deleting the user, ES would bring up a prompt/window with the deleted user's videos and UI on that page to allow them to re-assign the videos on the spot to whomever they want. summary: Multi program transport stream support
Mobile Geolocation for use in Streams
description:
#### Problem this feature solves
Currently, users viewing a live stream are able to see the aircraft and sensor locations. However, there is no situational awareness from the viewer's perspective of the ground units. More importantly, viewers who are ground units themselves are provided with little situational awareness outside of the airborne platform's point of view. Introducing a feature to share viewer locations will provide viewers of the stream with increased situational awareness, and provide an edge for ground units in hairy situations.

#### Expected result
1. Addition of a "geolocation" button on the video player control menu
2. Viewer locations who press and accept geolocation tracking will be shown on the map view
3. The map view will display locations in the form of either their name or a designated icon
4. Features will be copied to non-live videos as well.

#### Progress
**Frontend**
1. ~~Create React components for button and add to video-control container~~
2. ~~"POST" user's location (tie to existing "viewing" call that occurs every 5s)~~
    - ~~Response will carry all active viewers locations in a geojson object~~
3. ~~Create icon and layer within Leaflet~~
4. ~~Update positions through response data from AJAX call~~

**Backend**
1. ~~Alter database table "video_viewing_session"~~
  - ~~Add column to house user locations~~
2. ~~Write migration for alembic~~
3. ~~Make adjustments for PostGIS db formats from HTML5 geolocation format~~
4. ~~Alter the response to frontend call~~
    - ~~Write query for all user sessions and filter out any non-recent sessions (within 40s of query)~~
    - ~~Add all sessions into a geojson object~~
    - ~~Pass back to frontend~~ 

#### Updated Tasks
1. Improve and test backend implementation
2. Create a mockup of icons on map
3. Move into Stage server
4. Testing iterations
5. Push to Production server

Fluid feature. Subject to change.

summary: Livestream - refactor to make design more robust
description:
Livestreaming right now requires three machines (appserver, worker, liveserver) to operate in unison, to successfully deliver video to the web browser. Every two seconds live server creates a new video segment + updated m3u8 file. Then worker has to take this m3u8 playlist, and put it into a cache. Web browser requests fresh playlist from appserver, which reads it from that cache that worker wrote to. And then the browser makes another request to get actual video data.

A simpler and more robust design is possible. All livestream related responsibilities can be moved to liveserver. The same server would ingest video from ION, generate video segments and m3u8 playlist, postprocess the playlist and serve it to the web browser. This design is more robust, because it eliminates three possible failure modes:
 - failures due to problems with syncing files through EFS (which we actually experienced months ago when we started working on live streams and mitigated by moving everything into the same availability zone and updating nginx)
 - failure due to busy worker node, experienced multiple times. The last case was when Madison was testing, last week.
 - failures in internal AWS networks. Theoretical, but valid risk.

Additionally, this change strategically improves our position on:
 - lowering latencies
 - implementing support for deploying additional live servers - both for larger parallel live stream capacity and better geographical position in relation to the customer.

summary: Get ATAK server running
description:
Instructions from our contact below:

Main Recommended next steps:

- Get the updated TAK Server 1.3.9 Rel 14 RPM file

- Get the updated ATAK 3.9 and WinTAK 1.9.2

---- too many update/leaps forward to keep working with your existing versions.



TAK SERVER:

So, this should be pretty easy, you can even run TAK Server in a Windows HyperV VM on Windows 10 no problem. I have one running on my Surface Pro 4 and it talks to the local network no problem with TLS 1.2 AES-256 security....(lots to discuss but more later).

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/virtualization/hyper-v-on-windows/reference/hyper-v-requirements


The Setup guide you have is a little old and its a little trickier, but the actual Config Guide is buried in the RPM file and we can help there.


You have to either have a small "mobile computer" or you could HyperV on a Windows 10 computer...probably the ARS if it has enough RAM and storage space to share.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/virtualization/hyper-v-on-windows/quick-start/enable-hyper-v


---- Note, you can doe this on Windows 7 Enterprise with a update/patch...but I think that's the only Win7 way...




Just a simple summary:


A. Install CentOS (RHEL) 7  https://www.centos.org/download/

   You can install minimal or full GUI...either way

   Get PuTTY and WinSP to help do SSH based management

https://winscp.net/eng/index.php
https://putty.org/

B. Update CentOS online with current packages


C. Install the EPEL for CentOS  https://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/installing-rhel-epel-repo-on-centos-redhat-7-x/


D. Update Java  to 1.8


E. Install the TAK Server RPM install file...


F. Open required CentOS "firewalld" ports for TAK Server (can explain later)

   https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-set-up-a-firewall-using-firewalld-on-centos-7



Then it gets slightly more complicated for config...but depend on how you would want to integrate...


You still need to have ARS generate CoT data for all the dropped markers, Aircraft personality, SPI personality, and how the CoT Schema is implemented/controlled for anything made by ARS you want to share on a flat (local subnet) or via a TAK Server....the TAK Server could be onboard Federated via CELL or common datlink to a ground based TAK Server....lots of options...


Main thing is importing the ATAK icon set, especially the "team member" Icon set and the other icon pallets that are in ATAK (shoot for 3.9) so that it is compatible...


Also, need to be able to set following in ARS:

Civilian or Military aircraft
Fixed Wing or rotor wing or lighter-than-air
you can get crazier...but not normally needed
Set "Callsign"
Set CoT "Remarks" field with plain text notes
those are basics, but some others could be useful

Also, the downlink needs someway to be a multicast video...either by providing a Wave Relay or Silvus or Trellis Ware common data link with either internal or upstream multicast-er that carries the KLV/CoT metadata the WESCAM/FLIR/MTS-A or ARS is generating to the users on the same network (air or ground) in UDP H.264 so it can be natively consumed by ATAK/WinTAK....

There is a small mjpeg reflector server that might be an alternative...


I'm guessing the ARS isn't capable of generating its own STANAG KLV/CoT compliant video multicast stream?


Hit me up and we can discuss....


Thanks!
Sam

description:
A tool to help new users learn the Earthscape system. More details to follow, but the idea would be similar to modern websites that take new users through a brief walkthrough, highlighting the big points. Adobe would be an example of a company we could look at to model our tool. 

This tool would also double as a way to share new features/updates with existing users. For instance, with our retention policy implementation changing, we could bring users through a quick tutorial to show the new features and differences.

summary: Overhaul current KML/Reporting implementation
description:
# Background
----

### Problem:
The "KML" page does not provide importing functionality, map drawing tools, etc. These features currently reside within the "Reporting" page. This can be confusing for users as to the purpose of KML's within Earthscape. 

### Intention:
Clear up the usage of KML's, make it easier for users to import existing files, and improve the functionality of ES Web. KML's are not just for generating reports or defining reporting areas. They can be used to indicate power lines, gas lines, no-fly zones, etc. The following changes should aid us in doing so:

----

# "Overlays" Roadmap:
#### 1. Move features from various locations to new, consolidated housing
  - Change page/link name of "KML" to "Overlays"
  - Move "Map Editor" page/tab to this page
  - Add an import function for KML/SHP files to this page
  - Create a new tab "Manage Overlays" to handle the admin side of these files/categories
    - These categories could most likely keep their current functionality, with the intention of creating categories for "Roads", "Railroads", "No-Fly Zones", or whatever the user finds useful to group by color and category.

#### 2. Expand overlay usage in ES Web
  - KML's generate from flight path or imported by user, should be usable by the search function, viewable on the map while viewing a video (if not hidden in the Overlays tab or de-selected on map), exportable via KML/SHP download.

#### 3. Long Term
  - The usage of overlays could be explored even further at a later date to include viewing them within the video itself. We should be able to reuse code from our drawing-tools branch to do so.

summary: Cursor doesn't align when timeline spreader is used

**Actual Result**: Instead, the cursor hovers over just to the left and right of the end that is being dragged. 

This is in the same category as ESW-296

summary: Behavior of Timeline spreader needs revising
description:
There are many other ways of implementing the timeline spreader that may be better, but at the very least, the following behavior should be fixed: 

1. Go to any video
2. Click and drag on the timeline spreader (make the timeline shorter or longer), then release off of the timeline. 
3. Hover over the timeline spreader again somewhere in the middle
4. Notice how the the timeline spreader jumps to where the cursor is

**Expected result**: Once the user releases the mouse **anywhere** the spreader should lock into place.

**Actual result**: The spreader acts as if it's still being clicked. 

This also creates an issue where the user cannot click and drag the spreader all the way to the end of either side of the bar. Since, in order to drag the bar all the way to the end, the cursor has to be off the timeline.

summary: Pause button behavior needs revising (LIVE)
description:
1. Start/navigate to a Live stream
2. Press the 'Live' button if not already live
3. Press Pause

**Expected behavior**: The Live button starts flashing indicating you are no longer live. Pressing the live button unpauses the video and resumes to Live. 

**Actual Behavior**: As soon as the video is paused, the Live button **does not** start flashing. Pressing the Live button **does not** resume the video to Live. In order for the video to resume to Live, the user needs to press the 'Play' button, and then video resumes to live.

Actual Result: They are ordered Old>New (L to R)

summary: Exiting out of ION app during stream causes 'Live' stream to remain for >15 mins.
description:
Version: ION 4.4.4 loaded with DFES graph

1. Ensure ION is streaming to Stagescape
2. In ION software: Setup > Recorders > MX-10 Video (or HD-SDI-1) > Streaming > Start 
3. Log on to Stagescape > notice the live stream happening
4. Close out of ION app (either alt+f4 or power cycle)
5. Open ION app back up 
6. Repeat step 1
7. Go back to Stagescape and notice the live streams

**Expected Result:** As soon as the ION starts streaming from the same device from the same input source (e.g. HD-SDI-1) the first stream should no longer be present, and you should only see the second stream on the dashboard.

**Actual Result:** The first Live stream remains on the dashboard and "Live" until about >15 mins after you had initially closed out of the ION app. When you click on the first live stream, the video will play the last 10 seconds or so and then come up with the 'problem with stream source' message.

summary: Last Active date of users incorrect
description:
The 'Last Active' date in Users > Last Active. This date does NOT take into account if the user was "pre-logged in". Meaning, if the user had not physically logged out of the browser, the 'Last Active' date is referring to when the user had *originally* logged in. 

The date should take into account **any** account activity that happens by the user. This also goes for "users" such as an ION, ATOM, etc. so they know when they last auto-uploaded.

summary: Account Creation / Nature of server
description:
We should probably have a global installation variable that defines whether a server is "public" or "private".  A public server is one (whether it is on the public internet or not) which allows visitors to see videos without creating an account, and which allows users to create accounts for themselves.  A private server is one in which no videos are publicly visible, and only administrators can create user accounts.

LAPD should be a private server and Cole needs a way to create user accounts for his TFOs.

0:06.0 Frontend receives playlist.m3u8 containing chunk4.ts
